e4: Transitioning to the new policy aligns with ethical standards and best practices in financial reporting. Although it may cause short-term confusion among some investors, it will ultimately provide them with accurate information, fostering long-term trust and confidence in the company. This approach also mitigates potential legal risks associated with biased reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency. It should reflect the true financial performance of the company without misleading investors. Additionally, it should consider the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail and institutional investors, ensuring they can make informed decisions based on reliable data.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management team plans to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to investors, especially the retail investors who may be less informed. Additionally, I would inquire about the strategies in place to address any potential backlash or confusion in the market following the transition.
